content: "http://abclocal.go.com/wabc/story?section=news/local&id=6837353 quote: QUEENS (WABC) -- A 27-year-old female school teacher has been charged with the statutory rape of a 14-year-old student. The alleged incidents happened on several separate occasions over the past month. ... This is a big enough story in the New York area, but the thing that made me want to post this story here was the comments people made on the ABC New article. I've actually seen several people comment that the boy was probably looking for it, and when they were kids, they wanted to sleep with their teachers. I'm sickened by comments like that, trying to justify and even support the teacher and the kid, as if it was some sort of acceptable thing. One man who commented even said that when he was a kid (age 12), he had sex with his teacher and was "involved" with her for over a year, and he was PROUD of it. He called it his "fantasy." What the hell???

content: quote: Originally posted by Whirled_Peas: quote: Originally posted by NSNN: quote: Originally posted by Whirled_Peas: "http://abclocal.go.com/wabc/story?section=news/local&id=6837353 quote: QUEENS (WABC) -- A 27-year-old female school teacher has been charged with the statutory rape of a 14-year-old student. The alleged incidents happened on several separate occasions over the past month. ... This is a big enough story in the New York area, but the thing that made me want to post this story here was the comments people made on the ABC New article. I've actually seen several people comment that the boy was probably looking for it, and when they were kids, they wanted to sleep with their teachers. I'm sickened by comments like that, trying to justify and even support the teacher and the kid, as if it was some sort of acceptable thing. One man who commented even said that when he was a kid (age 12), he had sex with his teacher and was "involved" with her for over a year, and he was PROUD of it. He called it his "fantasy." What the hell??? I’m not saying this kind of behavior is acceptable, but you never had a “hot” teacher? I went to a Catholic school. You tell me. We had nuns, and then most of the lay-person teachers were obese or old, and Mr. Boyle, the only man, looked like everyone's grandpa. To us, teachers were asexual. Without commenting on the rights or wrongs of this case, when I was 14, there was indeed a teacher who I would have sold my soul to the devil to sleep with. And, recalling conversations with my peers, I don't remember them backing away in horror... Dave

content: The reason why we have judges decide sentences is because cases are like fingerprints. No two are the same. The justice will consider all the facts and circumstances before rendering his decision. This includes the history of the defendant and what's said in the victim's impact statement (NYS). Sentences not only call for punishing an offender, but also serves notice of what conduct will not be tolerated. This examines the totality of the circumstances and is more practicle than a rubber stamp; 1 yr, 2 yrs, etc. A sentence from probation to 7 yrs in prison can be meted out. If she loses her teaching license and must register as a sex offender it's likely she will never be put in a position of trust again with children. The courts in NYC may believe that's enough.
reply: The reason why we have judges decide sentences is because cases are like fingerprints. No two are the same. The justice will consider all the facts and circumstances before rendering his decision. This includes the history of the defendant and what's said in the victim's impact statement (NYS). Sentences not only call for punishing an offender, but also serves notice of what conduct will not be tolerated. This examines the totality of the circumstances and is more practicle than a rubber stamp; 1 yr, 2 yrs, etc. A sentence from probation to 7 yrs in prison can be meted out. If she loses her teaching license and must register as a sex offender it's likely she will never be put in a position of trust again with children. The courts in NYC may believe that's enough.

content: This is as much the fault of the liberalism running rampant in schools as it is the teacher... Liberals have worked tirelessly to turn schools into round-table discussion groups where everything except Algebra, English, and Science is taught. Race sensitivity, Gender Sensitivity, Sex Ed..etc..etc the list goes on and on. The Liberals have turned our once strict and rigid school system into a social engineering project. I'm currently in college and the only professor I respect is my 90 year old(yes 90) mathematics teacher. He is old school and doesn't take crap from anybody. Until our schools become rigid, strict places of education where children respect the person teaching them.....these liberal teachers will continue to feel empowered to abuse children.

This is a big enough story in the New York area, but the thing that made me want to post this story here was the comments people made on the ABC New article. I've actually seen several people comment that the boy was probably looking for it, and when they were kids, they wanted to sleep with their teachers. I'm sickened by comments like that, trying to justify and even support the teacher and the kid, as if it was some sort of acceptable thing. One man who commented even said that when he was a kid (age 12), he had sex with his teacher and was "involved" with her for over a year, and he was PROUD of it. He called it his "fantasy." What the hell??? I’m not saying this kind of behavior is acceptable, but you never had a “hot” teacher? "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: quote: Originally posted by Whirled_Peas: quote: Originally posted by NSNN: quote: Originally posted by Whirled_Peas: "http://abclocal.go.com/wabc/story?section=news/local&id=6837353 quote: QUEENS (WABC) -- A 27-year-old female school teacher has been charged with the statutory rape of a 14-year-old student. The alleged incidents happened on several separate occasions over the past month. ... This is a big enough story in the New York area, but the thing that made me want to post this story here was the comments people made on the ABC New article. I've actually seen several people comment that the boy was probably looking for it, and when they were kids, they wanted to sleep with their teachers. I'm sickened by comments like that, trying to justify and even support the teacher and the kid, as if it was some sort of acceptable thing. One man who commented even said that when he was a kid (age 12), he had sex with his teacher and was "involved" with her for over a year, and he was PROUD of it. He called it his "fantasy." What the hell??? I’m not saying this kind of behavior is acceptable, but you never had a “hot” teacher? I went to a Catholic school. You tell me. We had nuns, and then most of the lay-person teachers were obese or old, and Mr. Boyle, the only man, looked like everyone's grandpa. To us, teachers were asexual. Without commenting on the rights or wrongs of this case, when I was 14, there was indeed a teacher who I would have sold my soul to the devil to sleep with. And, recalling conversations with my peers, I don't remember them backing away in horror... Dave

content: The reason why we have judges decide sentences is because cases are like fingerprints. No two are the same. The justice will consider all the facts and circumstances before rendering his decision. This includes the history of the defendant and what's said in the victim's impact statement (NYS). Sentences not only call for punishing an offender, but also serves notice of what conduct will not be tolerated. This examines the totality of the circumstances and is more practicle than a rubber stamp; 1 yr, 2 yrs, etc. A sentence from probation to 7 yrs in prison can be meted out. If she loses her teaching license and must register as a sex offender it's likely she will never be put in a position of trust again with children. The courts in NYC may believe that's enough.
reply: The reason why we have judges decide sentences is because cases are like fingerprints. No two are the same. The justice will consider all the facts and circumstances before rendering his decision. This includes the history of the defendant and what's said in the victim's impact statement (NYS). Sentences not only call for punishing an offender, but also serves notice of what conduct will not be tolerated. This examines the totality of the circumstances and is more practicle than a rubber stamp; 1 yr, 2 yrs, etc. A sentence from probation to 7 yrs in prison can be meted out. If she loses her teaching license and must register as a sex offender it's likely she will never be put in a position of trust again with children. The courts in NYC may believe that's enough.

content: This is as much the fault of the liberalism running rampant in schools as it is the teacher... Liberals have worked tirelessly to turn schools into round-table discussion groups where everything except Algebra, English, and Science is taught. Race sensitivity, Gender Sensitivity, Sex Ed..etc..etc the list goes on and on. The Liberals have turned our once strict and rigid school system into a social engineering project. I'm currently in college and the only professor I respect is my 90 year old(yes 90) mathematics teacher. He is old school and doesn't take crap from anybody. Until our schools become rigid, strict places of education where children respect the person teaching them.....these liberal teachers will continue to feel empowered to abuse children.
